Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Persulcatusin (IP, natural AMPs; hard ticks, Nuttalliellidae, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; 3S=S; UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (94.7%) toAndroctonus defensinMol Wt: 4193.851; GRAVY: -0.47.Activity: Active against S. aureus MRSA (MIC 0.25-1 uM) and S. epidermidis (MIC 0.33-0.42 uM). Warning: other bacteria not tested.Toxicity: It had no observable effect on mammalian cell growth or morphology, on each cell DNA and on human erythrocytes.Resistance mechanism: 16 mutants from the Nebraska Transposon Mutant Library are more susceptible to peptide killing.MOA:bacteria:S. aureus: act on bacterial membranes and inhibit cell wall synthesis (Shimoda et al., 2024).Updated 2/2024
Literature Information.Author: Miyoshi N, Saito T, Ohmura T, Kuroda K, Suita K, Ihara K, Isogai E. 2016
Literature Information.Title: Functional structure and antimicrobial activity of persulcatusin, an antimicrobial peptide from the hard tick Ixodes persulcatus
